 10  # Indicator function
 11  
 12  `indicator (s : set α) (f : α → β) (a : α)` is `f a` if `a ∈ s` and is `0` otherwise.
 13  
 14  ## Implementation note
 15  
 16  In mathematics, an indicator function or a characteristic function is a function used to indicate
 17  membership of an element in a set `s`, having the value `1` for all elements of `s` and the value `0`
 18  otherwise. But since it is usually used to restrict a function to a certain set `s`, we let the
 19  indicator function take the value `f x` for some function `f`, instead of `1`. If the usual indicator
 20  function is needed, just set `f` to be the constant function `λx, 1`.
 21  
 22  ## Tags
 23  indicator, characteristic
 24  -/
